channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rosendale Road SE24 at the side of 119 Norwood Road, 9th November
item.description:
Rosendale Road SE24 at the side of 119 Norwood Road (Westmoreland Lodge) plastic yellow grit bin graffiti tagged about twenty or so yards from Norwood Road junction. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 282, Rosendale Road, Tulse Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lights out, 9th November
item.description:
Several lights by the playground/riverside were not fixed when the rest of the lights were fixed. On the other end of the park, by the bus hut, a light is out. This light has not worked in years it's very dark in that corner.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Street, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light in park or open space

item.description:
2 x mattresses fly tip top of stembridge road by communication box.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stembridge Road, Anerley, London

item.title: Denmark Hill SE5 at Ferndene Road junction (Ruskin, 9th November
item.description:
Denmark Hill SE5 at Ferndene Road junction (Ruskin Park side) there is a yellow plastic grit bin which is tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for picture and Google Streetview link: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4646761,-0.0902606,3a,60y,317.59h,85.96t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sVgKe_sCnox3OG3wYal_NUQ!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D4.03947105929646%26panoid%3DVgKe_sCnox3OG3wYal_NUQ%26yaw%3D317.59253941453943!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MTEwNC4xIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 126, Ferndene Road, Loughborough Junction, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Commercial canisters fly-tipped on Chaffinch Road, 9th November
item.description:
Couple of bags of commercial gas canisters fly-tipped on grass verge by railway line on Chaffinch Road. Opposite number 53.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chaffinch Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sandringham Road residents littering the streets immediately after previous littering cleaned up by council, 9th November
item.description:
This needs investigating, some residents are littering day after day even after council has cleaned up rubbish. There is litter strewn accros pavements and the road yet again.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sandringham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Lights Not On After Dark, 9th November
item.description:
Heading towards Thamesmead from Nathan Way to the flyover, none of the street lights are working when it is dark on either side of the dual carriageway.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Western Way, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 9th November
item.description:
2 large mattresses and 2 fridges dumped on the track road behind the row of shops/flats here. Around the back of flat 91A but not linked to that property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Queensway, Petts Wood, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned green waste bins used as general bins, 9th November
item.description:
These bins are at the beginning of the pathway leading up to the The Point, off Maidenstone Hill. Filled up with rubbish, been there 4-6 weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maidenstone Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hateful graffiti on electrical boxes, 9th November
item.description:
There is some horrible racist graffiti on the electrical boxes at the top of Hayles street. I have just noticed it today. Please do get it covered up I would hate for others to see that!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2,4,6,8,10, Hayles Street, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned chair, 9th November
item.description:
This abandoned chair has been dumped on a landing just off on the steps leading down from the little Hooke Community Garden on Dutton street. Been there between 4-6 weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Winforton Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Next to 64 St. Gabriels Rd, NW2 4SA, 9th November
item.description:
Dead fox found, have moved into bin bags as suggested on council website and put into a black bin so hopefully doesn’t attract other animals etc.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Gabriels Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Street cleaning - Dead animal on street

item.title: Unclaimed recycling bins have been used as general bins, 9th November
item.description:
These overflowing and unclaimed bins are located in the pathway, off Point Hill, leading to the steps up to The Point. They have been there for a couple of months. Bins need emptying and taking away as they do not belong to anyone.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43, Point Hill, London

item.title: To much foiliage, leaves etc. starting to build up on the pavement. It may cause an accident., 9th November
item.description:
To much foiliage, leaves etc. starting to build up on the pavement. It may cause an accident. Please can you send someone over to clean it up? It has been like this for nearly 2 - 3 weeks now. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Park, Crystal Palace, London

item.title: Road very dark and it’s dark early now and it’s not light in the morning either., 9th November
item.description:
